revised_title: Thermo-electricity at Low Temperatures: Influence of Magnetic Field on Sodium and Copper
tldr: The authors conducted experiments on the variation of thermo-electric power in sodium and copper at low temperatures in a magnetic field. They found that the variation in pure metals, particularly sodium, is very small and does not conform to the ideal quasi-free-electron model of a metal. The experiments on copper alloys, however, are well interpreted in terms of magneto-resistive behavior, showing that the anomalous scattering in copper and its alloys is not significantly affected by a magnetic field.
